column4: Do people recamend upgrading from breezy or doing a fresh install with is better or is there not much differance
if you dont have stuff you need to keep then a fresh install will be quicker and easier
!Automatix
why would it be quicker?
it is quicker to install everypackage from scratch than it is to remove, reinstall and reconfigure every package :)
a fresh install would be about 15-25 minutes faster normally
so you saying that most of my config file will not work
do you have a seperate home partition
no but I save most of my work on a separt fat32 partition
well earthen, if you have the time to spare, then you may as well backup to your NTFS parition and try the upgrade first
Ok i was jsut wondering what the end result would be, I alway tent to beleve that nothen is better than a fresh install
sorry for the bad typing my mind is way faster then my fingers!
earthen if you updrade then in theory you should get the same result as a fresh install, but you will retain all the packages you downloaded, and the contents of your home directory
however earthen, upgrade goes wrong in about 10% of cases
so backup your data whichever route you choose earthen
and I should be able to upgrade from the cd right!
earthen yes, read uboto's guide
!upgrade
I'm asuming it's just put the cd in the sources list
yeah cd in sources and then a dist upgrade: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DapperUpgrades
thanks I think i'll try the upgrade first but I will prepare for the full reinstall
yeah sounds like a good idea, just makesure your home directory is backed up and then you have little to lose
Thanks
